summary: This document outlines the terms of the Butterfly Trust established by Jeffrey E. Epstein, naming Darren K. Indyke and Richard Kahn as trustees. It details the powers and responsibilities of the trustees, the management of trust assets, and the conditions under which beneficiaries may be added or removed. The trust is irrevocable and governed by the laws of the United States Virgin Islands.

keyFacts: The Butterfly Trust was established on December 21, 2006, by Jeffrey E. Epstein.
Darren K. Indyke and Richard Kahn are the appointed trustees of the Butterfly Trust.
Ghislaine N. Maxwell is mentioned as a potential beneficiary of the trust.
The trust is irrevocable and governed by the laws of the United States Virgin Islands.
The trustees have broad discretionary powers regarding the management and distribution of trust assets.
